Why?

Jekyll hasn’t been updated in a while. Also want to deepen js skills, and learn GraphQL

  • consider staying on Jekyll?
  • learn Gatsby

Design considerations

  • does pagination help not load as much content?

  • where put the subscribe button?

    • at the bottom https://ericalayne.co/blog/page/4/.
    • home page https://ericalayne.co/ tabs
  • blog posts listings page, with search https://zenhabits.net/archives/
  • consider a newsletter tab to sign up? https://www.breakthetwitch.com/newsletter/
  • separate blog and comics page: oatmeal https://theoatmeal.com/blogs, has

questions

  • comics page: grid (instagram) or scroll
  • how to move between comics? pagination to “next” can get tiring
  • tags: where to put them? need on comic page, optional on blog post page?

  • not sure if need archive page. blog posts already have listing page, so archive page is for comics only

    • not a fan of text list for comic archive page
  • fixed header? take up too much screen space on mobile?

nice features:

  • URL changes but page does not reload
  • header becomes fixed hamburger menu http://sassandbalderdash.com/about/
  • related posts/comics
  • search across all pages

building blocks

  • gallery from github repo: https://github.com/simonyiszk/schdesign-web/tree/1ee8aa87b702a1ef0473e8a553207c3a2355d128
  • gatsby starter blog
  • gatsby docs on tags https://github.com/gatsbyjs/gatsby-pt-BR/blob/master/docs/docs/adding-tags-and-categories-to-blog-posts.md

by end of Saturday:

  • tags are selectable and filter the comics/blog posts on click!
